description:
Fun bar. 
Warriors game on at 5+ TVs.
Good price on drinks.
Awesome and nice bartenders.
2 pool tables.
Jukebox.
Good place to chill!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Came here to burn 2 hours while my boyfriend's tires were getting repaired a couple blocks away. (Ran over a screw, needed to change it ASAP to get home)

I asked for a chip shot (coffee alcoholic drink), and the bartender/owner thought I said "cheap shot" LOL -_-. So much communication confusion here... Owner was not the friendliest... I wanted to play billiards and asked her for change so I can put quarters in. She told us that we had to buy drinks first before I got change, which we were going to do... Anyways, it was only $10 for a beer and a shot. There was about 5 other people there who were all probably in their 40s-50s. I had fun playing billiards here but I doubt I would ever come back here again.
author: Leah A.

description: Bar was ok ,bartenders are nice and friendly. Let one get me for $2700.00 i was stupid. But i got it to throw away, never going back to that place again. Lol at least i had fun
author: Brian S.

description:
Fizzee's has a lot of potential to be a great place under the right management. Unfortunately, they have seemed to be struggling in the last few months. There heavy trafficked location seems to be the only reason why they have been able to make ends meet. The lady who owns the bar has overcharged me and my friends on multiple occasions. 

Apparently, this has been known to happen to several other people. After having a two beers each, we ask for our tab. The total was far beyond what 4 beers could be so we asked. The owner, the Asian lady, repeated that she has owned the place for 20 years and accused us of lying. I then went to the bartender who actually took our order. He remembered that he served us only beer, while the lady continued that we had ordered six shots. The miscommunication could've been easily handled. However, she lost her temper and started yelling for her bouncers. The bartender who served us quit his job right then and there. This seemed to even more frustrate the women and she started accusing us for the recent problem. The small bouncers were very intimidating and I was forced to sign for the expensive tab.

If you go here, don't give her your card. Just pay with cash upfront and you will avoid the issue. This was a very disturbing experience. I hope that they will consider different management.
author: Mac J.

description:
The only reason I give this place two stars is because they have beer... I had been to fizzies once before on a random Tuesday night and a middle aged pretty Asian woman served me and my friend. She was sassy and excellent at what she did, however, the boss was sitting in the corner continuously questioning her abilities and even yelling at her at some points! The next time I returned she was no longer working and instead a young woman who could barely speak English was working. 

The experience was terrible. First she questioned each one of our ID's, had no idea what was on tap and almost refused to serve one of our friends who has a Brazilian passport due to her lack thereof knowledge. To make it even worse when asked if they could play ANY music she told me I had to pay a dollar to do so. On top of this, the boss was sitting in the corner of the bar as always, however this time she was screaming and complaining. When we asked to finally leave they told us we were $1.50 away from the credit minimum so instead of getting another drink I just paid extra so I could leave faster. Awful.
author: Abigail M.

description:
This place is worthless, dishonest, unethical and in a complete leadership disarray. We had a server walkout on us and another couple other groups while we were there the other night. NOTICE AND BEWARE: There is a loud, mean and very aggressive lady running the bar. She's very unwelcoming and they seem to be praying and bulling on students by up charging their bills. It happened to a couple guy's next to us, they kindly asked the lady to remove the added shots from the bill and she started yelling and acting like a complete idiot! She called the little bouncers over and the guys just said, fine we'll pay your dishonest bill and we won't be back.

STAY AWAY AND WARN YOUR FRIENDS!! THIS PLACE IS BAD NEWS!!
author: Dustin L.

description:
**Warning: This review has a lot of people, so they've each been given nicknames to make it easier to understand**


I came to Fizzie's with two friends just two nights ago, one from Florida (we'll call him Friend A) and one from Brazil (Friend B), both 27. We probably got there around midnight or so. As we walked into the bar, we were asked to present our IDs by this man (we'll call him Presumed Bouncer) wearing a polo that had the Fizzie's logo on it (Very important detail!!). He checked my ID as well as Friend A's and we were fine. We had a little bit of trouble with Friend B, since the man (who I'm guessing was the bouncer or a manager of some sort) had no knowledge of international IDs. He asked for a second form of ID to confirm Friend B's age, which worked. I assured Presumed Bouncer of his age and he said we could go ahead in but just wanted to be sure since another bar just up Geary had been busted for allowing underaged individuals in.

We didn't have any trouble until we moved to the opposite side of the bar away from the pool tables and next to the arcade games. The entire time we were there before the move, we were fine. My friends ordered themselves some beers and me just some water. We didn't talk to anyone or arouse any suspicion cause we were simply enjoying each other's company.

As we all sat on our stools, one of the bartenders, an Asian woman (we'll call her Skeptical Woman A) with short hair checked the 3 of us out for a few seconds and suddenly left. We didn't make anything of it and continued to enjoy ourselves. Sometime after that, another one of the bartenders, another Asian woman (Skeptical Woman B) with shoulder length hair, starts questioning us, particularly Friend B. She asked us who had let us in, and I told her about Presumed Bouncer. She left and came back about 5 minutes later, to inform us that the bar in fact had no bouncer. Skeptical Woman B came back yet again and demanded to see Friend B's ID. He took it out and gave it to her. She took a quick look and left once again. She came back about 3 minutes later and started yelling at us, saying again that the bar had no bouncer and that she didn't know who it was that verified our ID (take the time and ask yourself, how the hell does she not know who her coworkers are???). Skeptical Woman B angrily spoke to Friend B, saying that he was underaged and that he was "busted and caught." Friend A informed her that he was from Brazil and that the IDs were difficult for those who weren't used to them, but once again assured her that he was the proper age. She then held her hand up in Friend A's face and yelled, "Just hold on, I'm not talking to you, so stop it!"

Skeptical Woman A left again, this time we didn't know what for. We didn't feel like sticking around to see what she would do next so we ended up just leaving. It was a very disappointing experience, especially for a Friday night on Geary, and even more so when two friends are simply trying to enjoy the city when they're from out of town. 

But what got us even more upset was the fact that she refused to listen to our explanation and refused to acknowledge that we had been verified by one of her coworkers and didn't even check with Presumed Bouncer to see if our story was true and decided to yell at us in front of other customers, which was quite entertaining for them I'm guessing. In situations like this, most establishments will bring the individual you are referring to (in this case, Presumed Bouncer) and see if everything checks out. Nope. Not with Skeptical Woman B.

I honestly believe Skepticals A and B thought we were trying to hide or something because at that time, that part of the bar was fairly empty. Most of the customers were sitting at the bar or just crowded around the pool tables. They probably thought were trying to avoid something (even though they both saw us when we first ordered our drinks).

Needless to say, I don't think any of us will be returning to Fizzie's (unless they get new bartenders and a proper bouncer). Skeptical Woman B is an extremely rude woman, which I can now verify from other reviewers who have faced her, and hope nobody else has to deal with her, her lack of common sense and her ridiculous sense of authority.
author: A. C.

description: THIS PLACE STEALS FROM ITS CUSTOMERS. I went with a friend for to have a couple of beers (we had a total of 4) once we received the bill we were charged double of what the bill should have been. Our bartender agreed with us that the bill was wrong but when he confronted the owner she told him he was lieing. We then confronted her to try and solve the problem, the owner did not even give us a chance to give our explanation when she immediately began our interaction by yelling at us and calling us liars. When we tried to reason with her she got fed up and called her bouncers over to intimidate us. After asking friends and neighbors about past experiences at this bar I FOUND OUT THAT OVERCHARGING IS A COMMON PRACTICE OF THIS BAR .I've never been to a bar with such horrible service.
author: Steven N.

description: Strangely empty on a Saturday night, weird bartender on a level I can't describe. Played one game of pool and left as quickly as we could
author: Ernst W.

description:
2 pool tables, arcade games, hot bartenders, and cheap drinks!  I had a lot of good times here back in college.  Needed to be carried out on a couple of occasions.

They also have regular barbeques for holidays!
author: Edward N.

description: $5 for a small can of Red Bull. That's more than double retail price. Not even the cheap but dirty pool tables or decent jukebox selection can redeem this.
author: Inigo M.

description:
With so many bars on clement and geary this would be one of the last to visit for a drink...but when an old high school buddy said to meet there I had no problem with it.

Personally the ambiance sucks and the help is not so hot.

Drinks selection is what it is...I choose a bottle of beer to be safe.

Place is sorta grungy and dirty.

I would choose abbey over this, plough and stars, dirty trix, okeefes,buckshot,the bitter end.....yatta yatta yatta.
author: David G.

description: This was my go-to bar during my college days. Unfortunately the interior hasn't kept up with the times and it has now turned into a dive bar. I hope this bar renovates in the future to stay in business.  The bartenders are nice.
author: John D.

description:
WHACKED!

Ok, so I'm probably going to get sh*t for this review but as an avid Yelper, I have to be honest and say, I HATE FIZZEE'S. Some of my (guy) friends LOVE this place and of course I can see why. Cute, flirty Asian bartenders in clubbin' gear; what's for them not to like? I can appreciate a pretty girl but aside from that and the cheap drinks (~$6 for top shelf liquor), I HATE FIZZEE'S for the following Top 3 Reasons:

1. DEAD: While nearby bars like Rock-It Room, Abbey's Tavern and The Bitter End are crackin', Fizzee's seems to always be dead. Last night, I walked in happily buzzed from Abbey's and nearly fell asleep after 5 minutes. *snore*

2. TOTAL COCKFEST: Old, creepy, eye-rapping dudes looking for their next prey...plenty of candidates for "To Catch A Predator" can be found here. 

3. BUZZ KILLER: People huddle in their little cliques (how Asian) and music played in the form of a juke box. Last night, some heavy metal crap was playing. UGH!

Other Notes:
*Divey
*Plenty of seating
*$20 minimum for CC's
*Two pool tables

After 3 visits, I think Fizzee's has totally fizzled for me...
author: Cherylynn N.

description: This bar is not good. I guess beer is beer, but absolutely terrible bar.  I can tell the employees are extremely over it. The owner is crazy and mistreats everybody. There are only a couple of options in this neighborhood, but I'd recommend 540 Club or Abbey Tavern.  Fizzees is where you go when there is absolutely nothing else to do. At least they have pool. And Daniel is awesome. Erin too.
author: Matt J.

description:
I HATE FIZZEE'S and I'll tell you why:

*Totally sausage-fest and I don't understand why. Yes the bartenders are dressed in clubwear but what's there to look at. I can appreciate a good looking gal but seriously...

*Dead, seriously...Friday night, all the bars on Clement are buzzing away and in here...snore fest is going on. So I guess I understand why we were kicked out for wanting to just play pool. Boo! 

*This place is a dump! The carpet in there is GROSS!! Place needs to be dusted and remodeled. I get serious allergies being in this place...even if it is just for 5mins.
author: Serena F.

description: Fun place to hang with friends in the daytime. Happy hour from 4-6. Free pool on Sundays . Drinks r strong and day bartender is funny. I liked it.
author: Kathy W.

description:
Not sure why there are 2 pages for this bar, but oh well ...

Your typical local dive bar.  Plenty of seats, lots of other bars to hop around to, near food spots that are open late, and don't overprice their drinks.

All-in-all an OK place.  Usually come through here when we want a chill night, with or without friends.
author: Pia V.

description: I remember going to this bar back in the late 80's and early 90's. We would hang out playing pool and the bartender was a good fiend of mine back in the day. Good bar to hang with your friends.
author: David G.

description:
I'm not really a divey bar kinda person, but I came open-minded on a Sunday afternoon. Lady bartender is very nice. Her margaritas are to-die-for. There was a lot of tequila in there but the best part of it was you couldn't really taste it...dangerously good! Prices are very affordable too. And it actually was clean in there, I felt comfortable & safe.

Also, on Sundays, there's free pool!
author: Alysha K.

description: Sporty decor. Definitely a dive establishment but they represent the genre well. A couple of pool tables. Sports stuff all over the walls and the close to the other Geary street bars if you want to bar crawl for the night. The drinks are very affordable and you finding a good seat to watch the game isn't difficult at all. The service is quick and friendly so I would definitely come here for a drink or to chill out after a long day of work.
author: Norris T.

description:
hey!
Theres I am looking at the strange smelling carpet with a gin and tonic in one hand and a hand in the other. Moving through this sporty sort of place where random people are collected for alcohol consumption I felt a tighter squeeze on my non drink hand. There I am again looking at the girls who's hand I've seem to clung to. What's all this?

"So . . . .", she said 
"I need to use the bathroom." Was my reply as I shuffled into the marginally clean rest room and read some graffiti. Drinking and peeing at the same time is usually a sign that it's time to go.
Fizzee's is an average bar that doesn't aspire to be anything more than a place to sell drinks and keep people drinking. I can't say it needs to be visited at all.

Done with the bathroom I left my glass on the urinal and gots the far away stride to find my way home, that Richmond mist reminding me that I wouldn't mind walking to the beach.

I can't go back to Fizzee's and it ain't because it's a bad place.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Came here on a Tues night at the suggestion of Ting A. who wanted to play pool after we left a slow night at a lounge downtown.  Okay!  I'm always game...

I guess I would say it's dive-ish but not necessarily a dive bar.  (I'd agree with Paul J. and Cliff B.)  Somewhere in between a dive and neighborhood bar.  But friendly none the less.  Bartenders were awesome!  Attentive, social, friendly, and responsible (and though it's not, it could be my sole purpose for the four stars when I overheard one of bartenders cleverly convince a patron to have a glass of water instead of what he ordered).  Not surprising that he needed one though because these ladies know how to pour a drink!! Thank you!!

Since we came to play pool that's exactly what we did!!  I am horrible at this game but I like to play anyway.  $1 a game...ask the bartenders who will gladly give you change for the machine.  It was a good night though there were some questionable in attendance but all in all, still a good night.

I secretly have the urge to somehow get into the walled go-cart (which I didn't even see when I was there) for a picture (as I've seen someone obtain on the other Fizzee's page), then get that picture of me put on Fizzie's cork board.  Woohoo!!  I now have a mission for the next time I visit heehee
author: Ninja H.

description: Best bar in the bay. Ask for the alcohol - you won't be disappointed. Ask for the hot Hawaiian mixologist - his name is Alaka'i - he makes the best jungle juice you never had in college.
author: Peter T.

description: This bar fits me just fine. Love the lovely bartenders. The high ceiling. The atmosphere. I can actually have a conversation in here.
author: Ferdy S.

description: Not my crowd, but decent spot to get a buzz on at 8pm. Digital jukebox had good tunes but the best songs cost 2 credits ($1) to play which was annoying. Might come back if I have literally nothing else to do but stoked that I didn't get carded.
author: Jack A.

description:
I live literally 2 blocks away and came here for the first time a few days ago. It's definitely a cool place to hang out if you're a local! 

The bartenders were very friendly!

I feel like I should come here whether I want a drink or just to hang out. =)
author: Mai W.

description:
Stopped by this bar on a Kickball pub-crawl. They had pretty cheap drinks, but the decor is kinda dirty looking. There was dust everywhere, I left sneezing...

On the plus side they do have a lots of TV's for sports viewing...
author: Stephanie T.

description: My friends and I had a terrible experience at this, not too special, run of the mill, unpopulated bar. We went with a large group and had 3 designated drivers, each of which were harassed by a very unpleasant bartender. She took every opportunity to pester and pressure the few people not drinking. At first we were understanding and tried to shrug off the animosity, but eventually our friends felt so uncomfortable they left. Thanks Tuesday evening bartender who felt the need to bully the few customers you had. Definitely will not be returning or recommending. Plus the beer was flat. Major bummer.
author: Annalyse B.

description:
Friend's bday...10:30pm....parking hard as usual...parked a block away.

place was fairly empty, only a bunch of friends but it got packed pretty quick...mostly our friends again, but mixed and nice variety of friendly ppl. henny shots were poured in cute lil glasses. friend got midori sour and it tasted good.

bartenders were friendly. everyone had a good time. more of a chill hang out bar, not really a make you wanna dance bar, since you can barely hear the music if theres lots of people. 

been here before when it was super empty, very chill and relaxing. clean for a bar..
would come again!
author: Christine M.

description:
Fizzee's gets 5 today. 

Stopped by on my way home from TJ's, as is my ritual, to play a little TOM

Gary, who owns the machines here, at Zeitgeist & around the Bay, was in the bar & bought us all a round. Super nice guy! Also put in 5 credits for me to play. 

I let him know the game at Zeitgeist was janky & he said he'd go fix it. The bartenders never call him so he was glad for the news. 
He said to call the 800# yourself if you ever have a problem.

TOM @ Fizzee's is all tuned up and playing like a dream! Go now!

You have the magic!
author: Blue R.

description:
Same old fizees. 

This ain't no dive bar. This is just the Dragon Lounge of Geary Street. 

Wow, just because you get some dirty old men gawking at the young asian bartenders doesn't mean it's a dive. Just because it's dirty inside doesn't mean it's a dive.
author: Earl G.

description: One of the neighborhood bars on Geary. The place has attractive female bartenders which leads to many male patrons. I understand most bars have many guys coming but this bar has more than usual. However, I like the music and the pool tables in the back. I come with my friends, when we just want to chill and have a couple of drinks.
author: Jason L.

description:
When I use to work around here ages ago I remember coworkers and I grabbed a few drinks after work.  It was pretty cool.  The bartenders were cute, the Golden Tee was in effect, the pool table well-balanced, and the drinks decently priced.  But I'll be honest, when I was younger we came here to talk to the cute bartenders.  The owner was pretty cool too.  Kamsa Hamnida, Mrs. Owner!!!

It's been awhile since I've been here, but I'm glad to see that things haven't really changed.  There's still a mess load of guys at the bar counters because of the cute bartenders.  The pool tables are still packed as usual.  And, the drinks are still inexpensive.

What's cool though is that they allow you to bring in outside food.  They serve you free shrimp chips or seaweed if you ask for them but nothing solid to really fill the belly.  There's pizza at Nizario's a block down.  Take it to go and bring it in to eat with your beers.

Great place to hang out with friends!  Mostly guys here though, so don't be expecting to chat with a teem of women.
author: Jules S.

description: Place is alright but needs some changes to make it better. Female bartenders are a plus but wish they could make better recommendations on brews and spirits.
author: Billy C.

description:
A nondescript dive wedged between abbey tavern and Ireland's 32. It was the least crowded of the 3 and had the most seating. The bartenders are cuties and outwardly friendly. 

The bar warps around 4 sides which is nice. Their drinks are cheaper than most of the watering holes nearby. They have two pool tables and a few arcade games. The jukebox is one of those internet connected types that lets you search and download songs. 

The vibe was mellow though not many females beyond the staff. Some punk kept lobbing coasters at the ceiling which was obnoxious but other than that it was a low key place to have a few beers. If I were on a crawl this would be one of my first or last stops.
author: Jordan P.

description:
Three Bacardi Cokes and three Goose tonics came out to $42. 
$3 for a Bud or Miller Lite, a pitcher were $10.
$4 for microbrews, a pitcher was $14.
$4.25 for imports, a pitcher was $15.
CC tabs were $20 minimum. Happy hours are 3-6pm; discounts are $.75 off a glass, though the regular prices are quite reasonable. Their Remy shots with Coke chasers ($25?) were too pricey though.

The female bartenders were cute (calm down dudes, their pics are not on yelp...yet, so will have to visit, yeah?): Jade is really nice and friendly, and Tammy and June were also fun and cool to chat with when there was a chance. They were talkative while so busy with the regulars/barflies. I can see myself hanging at this bar more often than others. Specifically, it would be on Tuesdays, Wednesdays or Friday nights, uhm, to play pool on one of their two pool tables. Just sayin'.
author: Peter L.

description:
This place has become my go to spot to get my bromance on with my buddy Lee.  Yes there are hot bartender chicks, but that is sooo not the reason I go here.  Seriously, after coming here so many time I hardly give them a second look, other than to greet the friendlier ones and order up.  Usually we just drink and play pool, and I must say we have a decent bar table pool game.  The owner is a sweetheart, and has the greatest master plan to draw customers, one I feel all establishments should adhere to.  Hire hot chicks.  Now I digress, wait a second, no I don't.  

Anyways in the daytime, the clientele is usually all white, with a slight chance of minority.  At night it's the opposite, mostly asian with a drizzling of white, and a hint of hispanic.  Don't let this intimidate you, it's always friendly and fun.  Keep in mind if you just want to gawk at the hotties, they only work at night, and the lineup changes daily.  Relatively inexpensive prices, a jukebox to play what you want to hear, and good times.  Don't expect to hook up with girls here, because usually there aren't any.
author: Brandon L.

description:
An Asian-ish-Irish-ish pub that blasts death metal music all night long, with a bit of Journey thrown in for good measure.  On my left there was a group of headbangers (literally, they were rocking out and screeching to every. single. song.) and on my right, there were a trio gambling with Chinese dice.  

Even with the free shrimp chips, the whole night just felt a little off kilter.
author: Joanne G.

description:
This is your typical neighborhood bar. I would say this bar is in a good location on Geary - close to other bars and food spots. There are plenty of seats around the bar.  The bartenders are so friendly -shout out to Aya! They are all very attentive and quick on their feet. Even when it's extremely crowded and hectic, I've never had to wait for more than 5 mins for a drink or two.

There are always lots of males crowding around the pool table area waiting for the next game. I would say this is more of guy-go-to-bar (if that makes any sense at all). The cute Asian bartenders are definitely a plus for most! The drinks are fairly priced. The Cheesecake Shot is a must try! I actually hate cheese, but I make this an exception. Overall, Fizzie's is one of those feel-good bars to chill with some close friends after a hard day's work!
author: Linda T.

description: This place is okay. Its kind of has this old, dirty, and grungy feel. Maybe not my type of atmosphere.
author: Anji W.

description:
nerdy asian guys and M.A.G. bartenders

M.A.G. = mediocre asian girl

how can a place named fizziee's be that place? well, it is.

you got the mama-san, the large breasted butta-face bartenders, and the all male nerdy asian guy clientele.  i cruised here on a wednesday eve with a few friends and ordered a few drinks. i had heard about fizziee's and it lived up to each and every expectation.  i'll go back, but i won't enjoy it any more or less than the first time.
author: Ameer N.

description:
I remember this place being a lot more entertaining 10 or so years ago....  

Was it cause of my youthful age?

Was it cause of the hot bartenders?

Was it cause of the decent prices?

Yes, Yes, and Yes....  

Is it the same, now, as back then?!  

NO, No, and No.
author: Danny L.

description:
03.17.10

St. Patrick's Day Pub Crawl - stop five.

Hey, this place stopped smelling like pee!  Whoohoo!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Huge shots at low prices.  Asian bartenders wearing skimpy stuff...open toe high heels...serving cocktails with cleavage...LOL

Pool tables in the back...small restrooms...old decor...a definite local dive bar.
author: Patrick C.

description:
This place is a dump. Great place to quietly kill an evening off with some pals, maybe kill some brain cells. The bartenders are cute, but they're really just there to milk the few sad regulars for tips, who are, in turn, just there to sadly flirt with the bartenders.

Also, be careful of the sad, lonely-looking Russian guy that looks like a geeky engineer and insists on leaning over the bar to hug the poor girls good bye. He'll stare at you, probably hoping you engage him in conversation, as he inaudibly makes comments about your conversation under his breath. I got a weird vibe from that guy.

The music is too loud, but the go-kart bolted to the wall is kinda neat.
author: Vincent C.

description:
5 stars for hospitality + pretty bartenders.

1 star for warm beer. Yuuuuummm! -_-
author: Alex B.

description:
This place is very "divey", and there tends to be more men than women here.  I went here recently, and surprisingly there were a good amount of women here.

Also if you want to be overcharged for a shot of watered-down Petron, this is the place to be.
author: Chan L.

description: The bartenders are really friendly and there is plenty of seating. This is the go-to bar for a quick drink or two or just to hang out with friends. The Cheesecake shot is a must try as well as the stoplight shots.
author: Loree T.

description: Typical bar on Geary.. Nothing special here. Cool that they have a pool table though. I actually just came in and my friends had a few beers, but I wasn't feeling the spot so we quickly maneuvered over to Buckshot a few blocks away.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Yeah yeah, so Fizzie's is a bit of a neighborhood dive, but it suits me fine!  Yes, the bartenders, for the most part, are young Asian chicks in skimpy outfits.  That's why it makes it so amazing that they offer such quick and attentive service!  (How do you move so fast in those heels, girl?!)  

The shots are colossal and cheap!  One time, I ordered a round for my friends: 3 beers, 2 cocktails, and 2 shots came to just $26, including tip.
author: Sam W.

description:
Fizzee's is a cool little spot on Geary and 4th. They have a ton of alcohols and beers, at pretty decent prices; $3-5 for beers, $4+ for mixed drinks & shots. They always have good music playing in here. They got a jukebox with all the jams, a pool table and random shit covering the walls.

I noticed the crowd is a bit uptight the past few times I've been in- notably last night. It is understood that this place is usually a locals spot, but if you don't like rowdy drunken guys at 1:45am, then you probably shouldn't be in a BAR!

The bartenders are super friendly, and super good looking. Unfortunately, as others have pointed out, aside from the lovely girls working the bar this place has a substantial abundance of wiener.
author: Mace M.

description:
On my 2nd visit to Fizzee's, I was less impressed.  The atmosphere was definitely less exciting... probably because my group made up for more than half of the customers in there.

It was definitely very mellow in there.  Good thing my company really enhanced my time in there... 

Even though I still had a good time there, I didn't feel like I enjoyed it nearly as much... hence, -1 Star from my last review.
author: Johnson N.

description:
It's okay. good place to go if you're just trying to kill some time. always seems to be dominated by guys (not implying that's a pro or con, just stating the facts). It's a pretty big place with pool tables in the back. 

There's a jukebox, which can be a good thing or a bad thing. It's good if it's usually playing music and the patrons have good taste in music; it's baaaad if the patrons have bad taste in music and the same songs are being played over and over, if any music is played at all. Fizzee's seems to be the latter more often than the former. 

The bartenders all seem to be blond haired asian girls that look, talk, and dress the same. it's kinda creepy. but lucky you if you're into that sort of thing.
author: Will T.

description:
Been here twice and the second time was just as unmemorable as the first time.

From what I could piece together, I thought the older patronage at the bar was hilarious. My initial thought was that a family function was taking place, but that didn't fit with the time of day or the locale. How else could you explain a dozen old men and women that could pass off as my great aunt's and uncles? 

Anyways its a standard stocked bar. They only accept credit cards if you spend over $20, which makes buying rounds for 3 people an inconvenience. Even though there is decent number of people in this bar, due to the number of bartenders, getting drinks is quick. Unlike most bars the place is also actually pretty well lit. So keep that in mind if you don't want to look at bud's ugly mug or you want to hide your vampire-esk, blood shot eyes. They got a couple of pool tables(occupied), juke box, and random ish all over the wall to you give you this mildy disturbing vibe. 

Also why are all the bartenders asian with bleached, blond hair? It is just one of the odd peculiarities of this place that adds to its charm.

The place is hardly feels "merry," so if you want a private, quiet place to sip on a brew then come here.
author: Cliff S.

description:
Yep, this place is a sausage party most the time.  A mixed, rather crotchety group of locals hang out during the day...and then it basically becomes the Patpong District (Google it!) at night.  Just kidding! sort of...

BUT, they pour a strong, cheapish drink and there are rarely lines for the women's restroom.  I love being able to pee when I need to at a bar.

:)
author: Karen F.

description:
I came here on a Friday at the suggestion of a friend. This place is definitely a dive bar, but if you're just looking for a chill spot to knock back a couple of drinks with good company, then this place fits the mold. It has a Cheer's type of atmosphere.

The staff was also super friendly which was a great plus because at the end of my night, I ended up puking my guts next to the fire hydrant around the corner and down the street. I walked back in looking like shit, my eyes red and glassy, pink all over (darn Asian glow), and my breath reeking of vomit and tequila. Instead of kicking me out, this kind waitress just offers me a glass of water and a smile. Now that is class.
author: Dennis P.

description:
I ducked into Fizzie's on a Thursday evening to catch a basketball game.  Fizzie's had about 7 small screens, and I suppose were a bit late to get a good spot, but the spot we sat down at was a bad angle for every single tv in there. The tvs were either too high or too far for me.  I still saw the game and that's all that mattered.

It was friendly crowd last night. The bartender called a cab for a patron, regulars helped out a drunk, and everyone spoke to each other like old buddies. The prices for the drinks were decent.  $11 and some change for a Guinness and Kettle One tonic.  Fizzie's had two pool tables and some bar video games.  I stayed long enough just for one beer and to watch the last quarter of the game.
author: Larry L.

description:
There's a simple profit plan for Asian dive bars in SF: 

Hot and flirty female bartenders + lots of booze = mad loot for the owner and lighter wallet for the customer.

Fizzie's was my introduction to this business model. How much I spent here is mind blowing. However, I can't forget the fond memories of such wonderful bartenders and regulars that made me feel as if I were the king of the world. Coupled with free shrimp chips, Korean onion ring chips, or Japanese snack mix, the sodium content of these items were sure to arouse a thirst greater than that of a Sahara desert trekker. Surrounded by gorgeous women and an ever attentive owner who made sure my glass was full at all times, one can easily lose track of time in this pseudo import model fantasy land. 

Alas, the reality is what Ice Cube said: You don't love me, you love my money. 

And so, Fizzie's, I regret to inform you that you and I are no more. It took some tough love to realize my life is better w/o a girl like you in my life. But don't despair. I'm sure we can still have one night stands.

Call me!
author: Jason C.

description:
Yeah, not the greatest.  Its a sausage fest.  My friends felt a bit uncomfortable so we left after our first round of drinks.

I'd come here with my guy friends. But unless you're having a girls night out and seeking this kind of attention then I would avoid this place.

I wouldnt classify it as a dive bar. It didnt have that "feel" to it. 

ps. snacks were stale.
author: Sun T.

description: It's a cool, real small little dive bar to just chill and talk with your friends at. The girls are kinda cute, but this was when I went back like 6 years ago so doubt they're still there and hope they got some decent replacements. It's a diverse crowd; mostly weird Asian guys that give off the vibe of being perverts or old men that give off that same vibe lol interesting. I'd go here for a few drinks and take some friends but def not the "it" dive bar you wanna show off or anything.
author: Lucky N.

description:
First, props to Euge for suggesting a stop at Fizzies.  And while I had never gone to the place in it's "AZN sausage fest days," I'll have to take his word for it that things were a little different back in the day.  In any case, it sounds like the place's atmosphere has changed quite a bit, although it still retains the same owner.

I was tasked to be a part of the Yelp advance party and so walked into the place solo.  Suddenly, visions of a thousand spaghetti westerns pop into my head, as the handful of scruffy regulars give me the WTF look....Uh oh--I've been here before...the walk into unfamiliar territory, territorial alcoholics wondering what the fuck you're doing in THEIR bar, monopolizing the juke box, owning the pool table, and just waiting for any excuse to toss you....you know the drill.

So, with some trepidation, I pulled up a spot at bar and ordered up a pint.  Not even a sip into it, a craggily white haired dude wielding a pool cue steps up with menace in his eyes, looks me over, and says....

"Hey, how's it going, my name's B____! you look kind of familiar, but I don't think I've ever seen you before?"  For a moment confused, I introduce myself and we exchange "good to meet you"'s.  

Expectations? Totally shattered.  

I go on to shoot the shit with the bartender and laugh as regulars exchange their 'no, fuck you you fuckkity fuck' jokes.  Euge drops in with a couple of ice cream sandwiches (cause that's how WE ROLL!)  Mmmm, Ice cream sandwiches and beer. (actually, strike that....not yummy at all).  Then came a crew of our dear Yelpies. 

The rest of the night consisted of lots of drunken stick, a hail storm of biblical proportions, bullshitting with our hosts, and a rock solid bartender.  The only real tension came with some controversial juke box selections, but Ed M. shot out with his puppy dog eyes, and we all managed to leave with our limbs....

In the end, the place may be gruffer than a billy goat, but seriously, appearances can be deceiving.  Don't get me wrong though, make one false move (like calling the bartender "sir"), and he will break out the baseball bat...
author: A J.

description: Alcoholocaust!!  I got destroyed by cheap drinks while watching the Olympics bigscreen next to a car mounted on the wall.
author: Sin F.

description:
Monday is an early Yelp squad crab binge dinner at Bay Fun Tong in the Inner Richmond, then Heroes Night at the @lpha Bar on Geary. Afterwards, we go for pool and drinks next door at Fizzie's.

Walking in, I'm instantly assaulted by the overwhelming, rank smell of hot rotting vomit. No joke. Ivy League frat house basements are bush league in comparison.

I escape to the bathroom, which honestly smells better, but hiding in the bathroom of a dive bar is a recipe for disaster... Remember Trainspotting? Yeah...

I suffer for twenty minutes, until nausea is about to win in a big way and I'm forced to leave. The smell inside is bad enough. I don't want to leave another contribution into the carpet.

If I were you, I'd give it at least a year to air out... by then, either you'll forget about this place, or the puke will rot out the floorboards and they'll be forced to renovate... inadvertently cleaning the carpets for the first time.
author: Perci N.

description:
I'm not Korean. 
I don't eat shrimp chips. 
There is a lingering odor of unflushed excrement.
The bartenders are nice except for the one that looks like Rupaul with two-inch long eyelashes. I have dubbed her "The Beast".
Heaven is not so heavenly.
They don't dance on the bar. They don't pour shots into your mouth.
There's an internet juke box, two pool tables, an AREA 51 arcade game, and an Indiana Jones pinball machine.
There's a car bolted onto the wall above the bar.
Pool is free on Saturday during the day, and all day and night on Sunday. 
Come on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
Watch out for The Beast.
Don't talk to the regulars or they'll bother you the next time you go there.
It's a dive. Don't expect anything more.
author: San F.

description: Me and my friends wanted to go out and drink on a friday night and it seemed like everything around us was closed. We decided to head towards geary because we know that there's a strip of bars alllll the way down the avenues. We finally decided to go to Fizzees and it was a cool experience. The drinks were yummy, not SUPER, and the workers and owner were extremely friendly. The owner gave us a lot of free drinks, and we loved her. The owner is korean so i think she liked the fact that i was too. She checked up on us regularly and talked to us a lot too. It's a nice casual place when you feel like having a few drinks and not caring about keeping up appearances so much.
author: Hannah K.

description:
I give this place a 4 star rating because of my expectations of what  a good dive bar has:

1) Cheap drinks
2) Cute bartenders
3) Pool tables
4) Good music selection in juke box.   

If you are looking for a club type atmosphere this isn't the place.  No fancy decorations or vibrant ambiance.  However, if you want a solid place to hang out with your friends and get wasted then this place is great.  I went here last Saturday for a friend's birthday.  The staff was friendly and it was just a down to earth and chill spot where people can hang out over drinks.  The Asian "McClarren's" on "How I met your mother" or  "The Central Perk" with liqour on "Friends", I would call it.  However, the user who
author: James M.

description: This place sucks so much it should be closed. Idiot bartenders w/no redeeming qualities nor command of the English language, dismal decor & atmosphere, overpriced drinks, pathetic jukebox and is only suitable for the 5 yocals who apparently keep this place afloat. Save your time and keep out. Besides the straggly male-dominated bunch that run the pool tables aren't worth even the character study. Whatever slumlord owns & operates this place should be ashamed of themselves. This place isn't even worthy of the term 'dive bar' bc it has no character nor redeeming qualities whatsoever. Besides, it's in Richmond. Why bother?
author: Sandra B.

description: This place has the baddest and most beautiful Asian female bar tenders. But it's not just their beauty that brings in customers, it's also their friendliness. I love this place. Last night some friends and I stopped here and one of the bar tenders shared a burger with a patron/stranger. WTF? Right? But she was really chill and felt like she was just one of the guys. Caveat: It's a local spot and there are some patrons who stare you down as if you don't belong.
author: M R.

description:
Fizzies used to be the default go to bar (roughly 4 years ago) in the Inner Richmond.  My sister, cousin and I even knew some of the waitresses.  Love the free shrimp chips and others (the sweet ones whatever they are).  The last time I went the bartenders didn't mix that great of a Gray Goose tonic (not too hard to make), but at least she was friendly.

Fun times can be had at Fizzies due to the multiple tvs, free snacks, and interesting crowd.  I've brought many folks here and they've agreed completely.
author: Marie B.

description:
I usually come here only on Tuesdays, when my neighbor/good friend Guy Spanale (of Swan Oyster Depot and Rattlecans Rock n' Blues Band fame) is off from work. We grab breakfast at Hamburger Haven and then--properly filled with greasy diner food--we chill at the bar with Kat, the Tasmanian Devil bartender. She even sounds like a cartoon character, with a deep scratchy voice, and a gruff but affable demeanor. Her B-day and mine are the same, so we're two Taureses who tease the hell out of each other and the rest of the regular crew who hang here in the daytime. 

Kat makes a pretty mean Bloody Mary, FYI.

I often chill and catch Espn here on the big-screen TV, shoot pool with Guy or Bill, a regular who shoots some pretty decent stick. Keeps me on my toes. I also hold the high score at Texas Hold 'em on the game console here, although I haven't played it in a while. No one had even come close last time I checked.

Oh, yeah, I'm a poker player too. More on that later...

The other thing I love about this place is the hot-rodded dune buggy that's actually hanging above the bar.

How it got there, I'll never know...
author: ACE A.

description:
After perusing the reviews, I realize I have to make something clear about Fizee's. This in no way is a casual drinkers haven. This is a serious, hang out during the day, and get shitfaced kinda place. I know this because I live two blocks away. Another thing is, DO NOT go at night. It does become an asian wonderland of weirdness, that doesn't bother me as a regular, but will definitely deter the newbie or novice drinker. The day time offers so much. 

Cathy the day time bartender or often times Heaven as she likes to be called are older hilarious women. Cathy has a smart ass remark for everything you say, and can generally be deemed more intoxicated than you. However, she will drink your ass under the table easy, if you want to make her happy buy her a shot of fernet. Occasionally Cathy gets in the mood, and will make a great chili, or sometimes for a customers birthday there will be some cake and birthday songs to be sung. 

This is a REAL neighborhood bar, all outsiders NEED NOT APPLY. 

Another perk of this bar is the regular and now long time friend of mine, BILL. He lives right next door, and has been currently building a stained glass huge carousel in his apartment (he has promised me a stained glass elephant... about a year ago, but I KNOW it will happen). He has a wonderful dog name Zulu, who you can feel free to pet and play with as long as you like. 

In general the daytime crowd is regular alcoholic wonders, not for the faint at heart. If you have the stomach for a lot of liquor and casual sarcastic banter this is your place, and you will fit in perfectly!
author: Margaret H.

description:
This is my favorite go-to bar any day of the week. Fair priced drinks, friendly staff, nice cozy "hole in the wall" bar. 

If you want to hit up a bar with close friends and have good conversations, this is the place to go.

I am so loyal to this place, my friends doesn't bother asking for my opinion on which bar to go to because my answer will be Fizzies.
author: Thomas K.

description: If you like pool, hot rods, and hot o-ree-in-tal foxes, then come here!
author: Art O.

description: I have only been here once and that was one time too many. My friend used to bartend here but she has moved on to bigger and better places...and apparently, so have I.
author: Susy C.

description:
$2 bud lights & the Nudie Game = my kind of bar.  

For a couple bucks you can have drinks and entertainment all night!  Don't expect anything fancy though, this place is seriously divey.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I kinda feel sorry for the guys that get suckered into going to this place just because a few "cute" bartenders decide to wear their minus 1 size bra that night.

Don't get me wrong, the place is a sausage fest most of the time. And YES it does smell like puke when you walk in. It's not somebody's bad day with their BO. 

Plus 3 stars for the selection of alcohol available. Skimpy outfits of the bartenders and the TVs.

Minus 2 stars is because the bartenders tend to badmouth their male customers and expecting to get fat tips to cover the monthly payments on their LVs and $3K Cartier watches. True fact, I even had a debate with one of my buddies about that before. Also the girls tend to have the tendency to be constantly talking on their cellphones while supposedly serving drinks which I find to be rude.
author: Joseph N.

description:
As one yelper aptly described this bar, "An Asian Coyote Ugly." 

However, I'm not sure that our princess-like bartender was  "Coyote Ugly" worthy.  This is how our conversation went:

Bartender (BT): Hi!  What are you guys drinking tonight?

Me: Do you guys have an happy hour or drink specials tonight?

BT:  We have beer and...

(So far so good, I suppose.  Although, I couldn't quite her what else she said after beer.)

Me: You know you could have said that it is always happy in here and we have great drinks!!

(I know cheesy, but that's all that came to me at the moment)

BT: Yeah, you're right, but I'm new here.

Me: Ok, how about an Guinness and 2 Anchors?

BT: Sure.

(A few minutes later, after she brings our drinks and I pay, I figured I continue the conversation.)

Me: So how long you have you been actually working here?  A few weeks?

BT: I've been working here for 2 years now.

(Now, I'm puzzled and so are my buddies.)

Me: That's good.  Thanks for the drinks.

Hmm...not really sure what to think of that.  A bartenderess who was cute, but who sure didn't know how to flirt.  As for the ambiance, the bar was filled with only Asian dudes,  I guess I wasn't helping the ratio.  Still, very weird for our very diverse city of San Francisco. 

Would I go back?  Maybe, just to mess with the bartenderess.  But then again, maybe not. 

Upon final review, they provide free shrimp chips, there is a pool table in the back, and lots of fluffy eye candy behind the bar.  I guess, you take it for what it is!
author: James C.

description:
Yes its total sausage fest.  Yes it's dirty inside.  

My friends and I go here before heading out to other spots.  It's a great place to chill.  Drinks are cheap, bartenders are cute, and who would have thought shrimp chips and Corona go so well together!

The best part is watching 40 year old men trying to pick up the bartenders.  You can't buy that kind of entertainment.
author: James Y.

description:
holy sausages!

sure, the number of dudes grossly outweighs the fairer sex, but my creep-o-meter has never gone off.  - - the attractive bartendresses keep all of the guys' attention, i'm guessing.  works out fantastically for me though, b/c then i can focus my bar energy on pool.  : )  

the last time i was there, the bartendress asked me if she could practice making a shot for me, and i happily consented.  ...really, who turns down free shots?  the irish (or was it scottish?) bartender ended up making my chocolate cake shot, who was hilariously poking fun at the bartendress.  ...i now have a new favorite shot.  : )

the jukebox has a pretty good selection (from what i've heard so far), and there are a couple of tvs to watch when you get tired of ogling the gals behind the bar.

as for the pool tables...  there are two of them ($1 games), and they're pretty decently sized.  if you're playing on the table that's closest to the bar, your cue may get in the way of patrons sitting at the bar, but i've never had a problem w/getting a shot in.    

*fizzee's.  not fizzie's.*
author: Ting A.

description:
Do not come here if you are a woman by yourself or only with a group of women, you will probably hate it.

Yes, it's a total asian sauasage fest.

But come on, shrimp chips!?!?! For free? Sorry, I'm just a sucker for that. Plus a pretty face serving you is a nice touch.
author: Alex C.

description:
It does smell like puke.

I thought I had thrown up on myself,but alas it wasn't me,so i ordered another Long Island..don't remember many asian's being there,just got pulled in there once.

Strong drinks,that is all I remember.
author: Mattee M.

description:
I used to go to Fizzee's whenever I felt I needed to just chill and grab a drink on a weekday night.  Maybe this will be a bit biased because my sis did work there and I'd often visit her, but I'll try to keep it honest as possible.  

If you go around 10 or later parking can be a drag.  Especially, if you're going on a good night weather wise, meaning NO rain.  Upon entering the bar, you immediately feel that this is a real neighborhood bar.  You have your regulars and then the occasional people that stop by like myself.  My experience with all of the staff (AGAIN my sis worked there so take that into consideration with my experience) was good.  They were always friendly and seemed to be very attentive with all the customers.  I've never experienced a time there when a customer had a problem with any of them.  It's a great place to go if you're looking to just chat with friends over some drinks while listening to music and maybe playing some pool.  I love how they give you free snacks with your drinks.  Two kinds of shrimp chips to be exact.  Yum.  

I admit, there is a weird smell to the place at times.  My sis claims it's the pipes.  haha....so if you WERE lucky enough to work while she did she'd always bring body spray with her and immediately start spraying the place as soon as she started work.
author: Christine D.

description:
The bartenders are really great. I stupidly left my favorite ring in the bathroom last week, and the bartenders saved it (even before they knew it was mine - I'm a regular), which just shows you how this place cares. 

Make no mistake, this place doesn't pretend to be anything it's not.

What it is, is a friendly local neighborhood bar. Come in on a Sunday to watch the Niners, and enjoy Cathy's free brunch (usually good old game food). C'mon! How many places do things like that anymore?
author: Blue R.

description: I'm still alive and well albeit a few years older and probably closer to my final resting place in Cypress Lawn in Colma.   But that doesn't stop me from dropping by my favorite dive bar, especially now that I live in the neighborhood!  Ms. Young the owner continues to be as friendly as ever. She continues to recruit young Asian cuties for bartending.  Do you ever wonder what old retirees do and where they hang out?
author: Ray H.

description:
I never stepped into here until my old coworker Jeff asked me "you been to Fizzees on Geary? There are hella Asians there" and the rest of history.   The location is decent and parking isn't the easiest to find but Clement tends to have a parking spot here and there on a Friday or Saturday night.  Keep in mind that I usually only come here on the weekend so I can't speak on this place not during these hours.  I once came down here on a weekday later afternoon and the barmaid was an old white chick and the patrons were all old white guys. 

The bartenders here are pretty attractive and pretty friendly.  The drinks are so so but hey I'm a lightweight so I can't really tell what's a properly made drink and what isn't.  The bar is a cockfest for sure but once in a while they'll be a hot chick in one of the homies' party...  

All in all, I like it  here, nothing top notch but i always have a good time here.
author: Jason Y.

description:
This is kinda my default spot in the Inner Richmond.  Drinks are decent and prices are decent.  It would probably be a three-star place if it were father away but it gets a four-star because it's my default "close to my house" drinking hole.

I also have many fond memories of this.  Like that time I got really drunk and got into a heated random debate about something pointless with some random dude.  And the 1,893 other times I did that after the first time.

It does kinda get Asiany later at night but it's not really an Asian bar.  I'm Asian so it's more like My Peopley to me.  Has two pool tables and free pool on Sunday so that's a plus.  

I dunno.  It's cool.  I like it.  It's the place where I meet random people (like former colleagues) for casual beers, grab some beers before partying at a more lively locale, and generally just cry away sad, bitter tears.  And drink. And drink some more.
author: Aron L.

description: This place was chill.  Free pool on Sundays, chill atmosphere.  Nice bartenders.  It is in the middle of a weird area that I was stuck in for a few hours and was a perfect place to hang.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Cool dive.  The bar is roomy and got pretty full after 9pm on a Tuesday night.  Came here for the first time with my friend Judy, this is her local hang out bar.  Great location, but it took me about 20min to find street parking at around 7:30p.  If you can, I would recommend taking the 38 Geary.
Yeap, the smell is there as soon as you walk in the door but it was not unbearable.  
Awesome bartender, Diane, serves good strong drinks.  She recommended their signature drink, Asian infusion (or something like that), that was good.  Made with green tea liquor, vodka and pineapple juice.
author: Yamil A.

description:
Okay, my review might be biased being the bouncer at the joint, but after reading all the other reviews, I thought I'd chime in.

1) Yes, there is a smell, and yes it is mostly from the piping in the place, but we are aware of it and are taking care of it.

2) The place may seem a little "dirty" but we did score a 98 at the last health inspection about a month ago, which is higher then most other places in the neighborhood. The place is old, it's been a neighborhood bar for over 20 years, and not much has changed, but that's part of it's charm.

3) Yes, at times it is a total sausage fest in the place, but women should not feel uncomfortable coming in. If anyone gives you grief, either I, or one of the die-hard regulars will take care of the offending party.

4) No, I am not racist or prejudice in any way. I love seeing a diverse crowd at Fizzee's, but I do take my job seriously, which means:

a) No ID, no entry, no exceptions, and don't even think about using a fake, I have been trained to spot most fakes. I'm not perfect, but do you really want to risk being embarrassed if I catch you?

b) If you are drunk off your a**, you're not getting in. It is a liability to the last bar that serves you if you hurt yourself or someone else while being intoxicated.

c) I have a zero tolerance policy, if I catch you harassing the bartenders or other customers, you're out, maybe not 86'd, but definitely out for the night.

Fizzee's has earned a reputation of being a "safe" bar with the local PD, they know that the owner enforces all applicable laws, so they mostly leave us alone. It's my job to make sure it stays that way. However, we try to keep the atmosphere at Fizzee's chill, so as long as everything stays chill, you might not even know I was there.
author: Man S.

description:
This is an all right bar. It's too "dive." The place was a bit too worn down for me. They also need to upgrade their TV sets. There's a cute Asian bartender working there to provide all the flirts you want/need (so they can get more drinks from you!!!). I definitely digg the go-kart hanging from behind bar. I wish I can take it down and go for a spin around the block (only while sober of course).

Again, this place is okay and decent bar. If you're near it, it won't hurt going in and having a drink or two.
author: Sam W.

description: Great Family owned business for that at home feeling you get at most dives.  Friendly and chill.
author: Kimberley S.

description:
1. Hot asian bartenders

2. Odd puke smell from bathroom areas

3. First time I have tried a 'asian persuasion' drink...green tea liqor and vodka I think...good stuff

4. Hot asian bartenders

Went there on a Thursday night, not packed, and see #'s 1 and 4.
author: Nic K.

description:
Fizzie's is a pretty kewl local bar.  Like others have mentioned in their reviews before, yea it definitely has that dive bar vibe and look to it.  But for you can get some pretty good beer on tap for only $5/glass or $15/pitcher (at least the last time I was there a lil' while back)  They always give out unlimited shrimp chips to grub on w/ your drinks, so that's always been nice.  There's also the usual pool tables and arcades for you to amuse your drunken friends with.   

All the bartenders are Asian females, so if you're not really into that, perhaps it might not be a place you'd like, and they're all really chill and kewl to chop it up w/.  The crowds are mixed sometimes, but it seems like most of the times I've been there, it's mostly an Asian crowd and some other random locals.  The vibe has always been chill, and I've never seen any jackasses start any fights or anything here.  It's definitely worth dropping by and checking it out if you're in the area and want a cheap drink.
author: Minh V.

description:
Avoid as much as possible.

But on the nights you can't, you'll survive... and you'll probably have a new story too.
author: Rashmi N.

description: We love Kathy here =) Some of the young Asian chick bartenders are nice too, but I've had a few encounters with ones that were more than just bitchy (this was years ago though). I mean, I get it, they're there because they can make drinks fast and are nice eye candy for the fellas, but it seems like a completely different "vibe" than when Kathy is bartending.
author: Zoeboe D.

description:
Wouldn't dare go here at night... but gotta love the free pool on Sundays and the $2 beers. 

I heart Kathy the bartender!
author: Kate Y.

description:
I started coming here back during the summer before my junior year of college when I was still using my 'Nicaraguan' ID (note: I was born in SoCal). At this point a friend of mine was still bartending here so we would of course get awesome service. All the fish chips we could ever want while being entertained by water fights, toothpick magic tricks and the owner's homeless looking son who just sits in the corner all night. 

It is really hit or miss with this place. Some nights it is so crowded you can't walk through the door, some nights it turns into a strictly Asian scene, and other nights it is a great place to play with the jukebox.
author: Lee M.

description:
Not a bad place. Video arcade games at the bar, pool table and juke box in the back.  Just as Lee M. says, its hit or miss. Sometimes theres a big mix of people, and sometimes its full of asian people.

The owner gave my friend a free stoplight for his birthday hahaha. a drink consisting of 3 parts, 1 green, 1 yellow, and 1 red. 

Best Bartender is Diane (not sure if shes there anymore) - Order "Yo Mamas Kool-Aid" from her, she is the only one that knows how to make it.
author: David D.

description: Ok... I've read the reviews and yes, I agree it smells funny.  It is because of some pipe problem that is getting worked on.  The place is hella old and it needs some fixin but I the people are nice and I consider friends, not just customers.  After all, I work there... So gotta support it despite the smell... But I will let the owner know about the smell and hopefully get it fixed asap because Fizzees is a great place with lots of memories!
author: abbey e.

description: It's hard for me to refer to Fizzee's Sports bar as a dive bar. It's also hard for me to call it a sports bar. They do have lots of TVs set up around, but good luck finding someone who can find the game you want. It's a good bar for locals and out of towners and there isn't a heavy turnover with the bartenders unlike some of the local competition. Prices are reasonable and its a good place to meet up friends on the weekend.
author: Savage D.

description: I came here for the fourth stop on the St. Patrick's pub crawl. The place was rather quiet inside even though it was half full. The staff was friendly but the bar was too quiet for me. I got the feeling the bar was more over a neighborhood bar. The music was played from a digital juke box but there was no one dancing. Most people were hanging out around the pool table or up at the bar. The staff was overtly friendly but this bar scene was not for me. It was too quiet for me.
author: Pete N.

description: I like to come here once in a blue moon. It's not the hippest bar but it's alright.. They have a pool table and pinball machine! Happy hour is 4-6 and on Sunday, pool is FREE.. When I first came here, the bartender didn't know how to make an Adios Motherfuck. I was like telling her what's in it. How can a bartender not know what a Adios M'fucker is?
author: Juliane N.

description: fizzee's aka "asian coyote ugly"...nuff said...
author: Hen A.

description: Smells like puke, as mentioned by other reviewers. Even with attractive bartenders, I don't get how crowded it is here with the smell.
author: Keith K.

description: I would call this a 'Dive Bar' all due to the fact that the only women in this bar are the Bar Tenders (most are cute and utilize the general cities 'Yellow Fever' epidemic).  But in essence, i really cant say it due to the fact that it's almost never empty, and most people that go to this bar (horny college guys in need of a drink and cute made up kabuki Asians to stare at) are generally happy and entertained.
author: Riko H.

description:
gotta give them some love. sure youre more than likely to get cut up in this HUGE swordfest, but love for all the times i was a belligerent drunk and i was taken care of. 

*trying to remember last bday*

que 50 or so of my fav folks, me with my pants around my ankle, smacking people on their asses with my studded belt. 

*few bdays ago*

que drunk euge..........

shirt unbottoned, exposing the lovely beer belly, a bottle of remy in each hand.... straws of course, dancing (read stumbling) around. 

" PPLAYY SSSHAAT PPPPUCKEN FIDDDDY SONG. ' GO SHORTEE. ITS YER BIRFDAY ' "

for putting up with my drunk ass, four stars.
author: Euge L.

description: I can only say I've been here twice because I went to Would You Believe? more often since I worked there in the past but many of the regulars at WYB? were regulars at Fizzee's and it always amused me how they'd compare the bartenders saying that the Fizzee's girls are more agressive and sexy compared to the WYB? girls
author: kristin e.

description:
After being held hostage for four hours by a "restaurant" and its "staff," we were thirsty.  Thanks to my handy iPhone we found Fizzie's.  

After walking around a group of Cantonese guys smoking weed (and no very successfully as evidenced by the loud whooping coughs), we walked in.  

The place is divey but not so much that you don't wanna put down your jacket for fear that a family of mice will nest in it.  The bar is on the left, long and shaped like an "L."  There are a few raised tables on the left and pool tables and bathrooms in the back.

Once we walked in the bartenders directed us to the horizontal part of the L shaped bar and took our orders.  The staff was very nice and poured good drinks.  (One girl even asked if we wanted "strong drinks.")

The prices were great; $5-6 for Jack and Cokes, gin and tonics, etc.

The music was a pleasant mix of hip hop and top 40.

The only minus was a girl sitting next to us kept yelling, "Tighty whities?  NO!  LOOSEY WHITIES!" and then cackling.   I guess it was one of those "you had to be there" jokes.

Would definitely come back if I was in the area and was once again parched.
author: Paul J.

description: Great neighborhood bar with 2 pool tables in the back.  Only $1 for a pool game...not bad!  Drinks are cheap and they have an awesome digital jukebox.  For a dive bar this is a pretty chill and fun bar.
author: Annie S.

description: I went here on my birthday and I got a free stoplight! From what I remember its a very friendly atmosphere
author: Irvin David U.

description: Mostly dudes here at the Asian bar.  You got the cutesy bartenders.  Plus they have two pool tables.  The jukebox plays some good tunes.  But something about the place never made me feel too comfortable.
author: Sam T.

description: yup been coming here for years. such many bartenders has come and gone but something remains the same. the girls are always friendly and genuinely wants you as their customers. treat them well and they will do the same. oh yeah I LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Q L.

description: been here a few times. love all the bartenders
author: jeff s.

description: Fizzie's is a cool little asian dive place in richmond.  Ive been there quite a few times, but i ain't really played pool or nothin like that.  I like chillin with the quarter machine.  It's a cool little spot.  Bartenders are all female and pretty cool.  Juuuust flirty enough to make you feel welcome.  Everyone's pretty nice.  But like all dives, it gets boring if you stay too long.
author: Jason D.

description: nice place to hang out. good selection for alcohol. bartenders are nice except for the irish guy
author: mister f.

description: This joint is alright... but the people that I've meet here are just too laid back and chill that i have to give it a high score.
author: Jose S.

description:
it's a bar for asian people, without a doubt, but the majority of the population is the same bunch of creepy people that hang around Dragon Lounge on Taraval to talk to the bartenders. 

you come here to drink and relax, not to dance, so if you're up for that then go back to Alpha Bar. drinks are reasonably priced and service is prompt.

they DO take credit cards, but there's a $20 minimum, so bring friends. or be depressed.

everything inside is also generally dirty, but you learn to live with it when you realize you aren't at a club. 

come here to commiserate over what the night could have been, or to talk of your latest conquest. you don't even need to yell!
author: Charles C.

description: Like the doulble ee's suggest, Fizzee's is hella ghetto.  Sure they serve alcohol.  But even a bar doesn't have to smell like puke.  I've been here a couple of times just to stop in for a beer, and each time I leave rather underwhelmed.  One thing I did notice once was the bouncer turning away non-Asians.  I can understand wanting to keep a certain demographic to your clientele, but is that even legal?  At any rate, there are enough watering holes in the Richmond district.  This is one I do not recommend.
author: Tony L.

description: Irish Bar?  More like Chinatown.  I'm all about the diversity at bars, and if you're like me, this place ain't for you.  I did have fun the first time i went there.... but that's only because my friend and i hopped in there drunk to begin with.  Plus the lady bartender was friendly.  2 1/2 stars for the bartender and the cool jukebox.  Other than that, its just a bar filled with asian dudes.  no thanks.
author: Kevin S.

description: Free corned beef on St. Patty's Day.  Worth the drop in.
author: Christina S.

description: wow, place has changed since i think 4 years ago the last time i was there. kinda empty on a saturday night around 11-12 is pretty bad. I would recommend if you like asian girls tho, most of the bartenders here are decent but not as good as they used to be... maybe next time will be better!
author: Gordon L.

description: This is a nice place to drink with friends and hang out. Use to be a lot more fun back in 4-5 yrs ago. Where is all the ..........................?
author: Peter C.

description: Its like going to a strip club with all Asian girls, hence no nudity. They take all your money and you go home drunk and alone.  There are way to many dudes in here.  Good luck playing pool.
author: Robert M.

description: fizzee's aka asian coyote ugly. i've only been here on occasions. cute bartenders, but too much of a sausage fest for my taste. my only bright side was getting fed beef jerky by some random girl. what the....??
author: Darren W.

description: Definitely a dive bar that needs to be remodeled.  Not as good as it used to be years ago back in the day. Bartenders also not as hot as before.
author: Happy G.

description: used to be a regular from 2002-2004...i've yacked many times outside...it's a great timeout
author: Erik T.

description: My friend had a rendezvous here so I thought I'd tag along for a couple drinks. It's at a corner with two entrances/exits at each side of the bar. I trip off things like that just in case there's a fire or some kind of emergency. I went in and ordered a Cabarenet. Low and behold, I am served with the same wine I usually get served at my regular watering hole. I'm starting to feel at home already. This place is pretty large and the bar is like an L shape. So if you're at one corner, you can't see the other corner. Not sure why it's designed that way. Two pool tables is a plus. The decor of this place is pretty much all sports bar. To be quite honest, I think it's over decorated with beer banners. They're everywhere. They can tone it down a little. Or maybe a lot. The main focal point is the old school hot rod mounted over the bar. Really cool. However, I'd be lying if I told you it didn't make me nervous. The bartenders that night were cute girls. They seemed nice and ran the place well. The crowd was mostly male yet a fair amount of females. I will definately come here again. My only complaint is their need for a minor makeover and new LCD TVs.
author: Butch M.

description: I make no apologies about this place. It's a dive bar with plenty of sports on TV.  I've known a few of the bartenders here over the years and they're both nice and friendly to talk to and competent with the drinks.  It's a mostly Asian crowd but they don't hassle non-Asians unless you're blatant with your Asian girl fetish.  The crowd is mostly there for one of two things or both: fair priced drinks or the mostly HOT bartenders.
author: Erick K.

description: This place is cool, I guess, I live two blocks away so i have been here a few times to watch a game. Lots of tvs to watch your game on, good prices on pitchers, but i couldn't really see hanging out here alot, not crowded at all and kinda boring.
author: R T.

description: good place to just sit down and hang out. if you want to meet someone who's not an old trucker or canton uncle, then don't come here.
author: RJ C.
